meanings.definition: Endomorphisms: linear transformations from a vector space to itself.
meanings.sent1: The endomorphisms of the vector space were crucial in solving the mathematical problem.
meanings.sent2: Mathematicians study endomorphisms to understand how vectors behave within the same space.
meanings.sent3: The endomorphisms of the vector space threw a party for all the vectors, but only the unit vector showed up.
meanings.sent4: The endomorphisms acted like a mirror, reflecting the vectors back onto themselves.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing endomorphisms is like watching a dance where each vector dances with its own reflection.

meanings.definition: Endomorphisms: mappings from a set to itself.
meanings.sent1: The endomorphisms of the set preserved the elements within the same group.
meanings.sent2: In computer science, endomorphisms are used to represent self-referential functions.
meanings.sent3: The endomorphisms of the set decided to play a game of tag but kept tagging themselves.
meanings.sent4: The endomorphisms functioned like a loop, continuously mapping elements back to themselves.
meanings.sent5: Understanding endomorphisms is like looking at a map where every location leads back to itself.
